Silence::

"Hmm, well, if this thing as you told me earlier is intertwined with
her form, then we would have to seprate them very carefully. First we
would have to remove her from herself so that the parasite could be
removed. However, we would need a protoform, anther spark chamber, a
cr chamber, and it possible, a spare brain per say to duplicate or
download all her programs onto a back up just in case. Hmmm, but it's
possible. Very possible. I wonder if we could comminucate with this,
ah, Sedna by itself? Wonder where it came from and what it needs? If
it needs a form, then we might give it a protoform of it's own if it's
on our side. Perhaps the only way it could communicate with us at all
was to possess another bot to do so."  She whispered, "Interesting,
very interesting. So many questions, and I wonder what the answers
are."  SHe turned and looked at Rodimus. "Sir, where is she now?"



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Rodimus:
> 
> the male sighed "I don't know more about this creature... excpet
that it's a femme and call hersel Sedna"
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Dark Mouse 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Monday, May 23, 2005 6:10 PM
>   Subject: Re: Windlord/Rodimus/Malice
> 
> 
>   Silence::
> 
>   She turned to Rodimus. "Uh, well, it may or may not be what you wanted
>   to hear. But first, I must ask to be able to see the object itself
>   before I do anything. One cannot damage the host of a parasite to
>   remove the parasite. The host is the victim and must survive. But, if
>   it is discovered that it is a symbiotic relationship, both may
>   actually be benefitting. However, if from what you have told me, be as
>   little as possible as it may have been, I will endevour to
>   successfully remove this, erhm, thing from your beloved."  She tried
>   to as a little flair to her performance, hoping to the Matrix that it
>   might instill a little confidence in Rodimus that she might actually
>   know more than she did. It wasn't that she wasn't really smart, she
>   was. But this would be her first mission, so to speak. And she wasn't
>   going to let anything come between her and success. SHe gave him a
>   hopeful smile, "Is there anything else about this Vok instrument that
>   I'll need to know?"
> 
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
>   > Rodimus:
>   > 
>   > Rodimus smiled back, it seems that the little one was camly, that
>   was good. He looked her and said "About your asignamets I was thinking
>   that you could help us to take that Vok's thing away my wife... and I
>   remember that you had a plan..." 
>   >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   >   From: Dark Mouse 
>   >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   >   Sent: Friday, May 20, 2005 1:52 AM
>   >   Subject: Re: Windlord/Rodimus/Malice
>   > 
>   > 
>   >   Silence::
>   > 
>   >   She looked at him. She let her optics look closer at Rodimus.
>   >   Something in him reminded her of someone. Someone from her past.
>   >   Someone she respected and honored. She smiled back at him with
a smile
>   >   that reflected the relief she felt just by knowing he thought
all was
>   >   alright.
> 
>
